tweet: @dawnmannay And sometimes even out of words/the verbal - we have knowledge which is not and cannot be verbal, and creative methods can help us express and share that knowledge #CRMethodsChat

tweet: @kate_wall98 @EleanorHotham Thank you Kate. I start from the standpoint that we are all researchers and we are all experts - we are not all expert in the same thing, but everyone is an expert in something, and that can benefit research and practice too in my view #CRMethodsChat

tweet: @EleanorHotham @kate_wall98 Then for what it is about creative research: creative uses of arts, technology, even everyday activities such as talking and walking, can enable expression which is stifled by more conventional approaches #CRMethodsChat

tweet: @EleanorHotham @kate_wall98 I see it less as voices emerging, or people being given voice, because the voices are already there and perfectly functional. For me it's more about creative research providing ways to amplify these voices which are so often muffled or silenced #CRMethodsChat

Typo of the day, from a funding bid I'm assessing for its ethical position:

"[Project] seeks to comply with the tenants of research ethics."

I know we have a housing problem here in the UK, but that doesn't seem like a solution!

(Moral: do not rely on the spell checker.)

name: Helen Kara 🇺🇦 #FreeUkraine
description: Indie researcher+author. Teach postgrads+ECRs. Keynote speaker. For hire worldwide. "Whirlwind of awesome" (@tseenster). She/her. #ActuallyAutistic 🌈
tweet: @aortmannphd @tylershores @ThinkLabCam @DrAimeeGrant @LSEImpactBlog I know terminology and views on inclusivity are often different in Aus than in the UK. My experience as an Autistic scholar reading your article was to feel quite diminished. Even in the broadly positive conclusion, you are still describing Autism as an affliction.

name: Helen Kara 🇺🇦 #FreeUkraine
description: Indie researcher+author. Teach postgrads+ECRs. Keynote speaker. For hire worldwide. "Whirlwind of awesome" (@tseenster). She/her. #ActuallyAutistic 🌈
tweet: @aortmannphd @tylershores @ThinkLabCam @DrAimeeGrant @LSEImpactBlog I read your article, and I saw that it concluded with a positive point. I found it difficult to read the rest because of all the terms such as 'afflicted with', 'impaired... abilities', 'abnormal', 'delayed', 'limited', 'lack' - to my UK eyes this gives a very ableist impression.

name: Helen Kara 🇺🇦 #FreeUkraine
description: Indie researcher+author. Teach postgrads+ECRs. Keynote speaker. For hire worldwide. "Whirlwind of awesome" (@tseenster). She/her. #ActuallyAutistic 🌈
tweet: @aortmannphd @tylershores @ThinkLabCam @DrAimeeGrant @LSEImpactBlog I guess the terminology is different in Aus. In the UK we now use Autism, not Asperger's (rationale: https://t.co/nZ5mZx5kOA). Also we do not view Autism as an 'affliction' with 'symptoms'; that is an ableist perspective. Autism is one of several forms of neurodiversity.

name: Helen Kara 🇺🇦 #FreeUkraine
description: Indie researcher+author. Teach postgrads+ECRs. Keynote speaker. For hire worldwide. "Whirlwind of awesome" (@tseenster). She/her. #ActuallyAutistic 🌈
tweet: @virtualnotviral Indeed I do. I wrote a blog post on this a while ago, which includes a link to one of my own book proposals https://t.co/pHDhJagdKx #VirtualNotViral

name: Helen Kara 🇺🇦 #FreeUkraine
description: Indie researcher+author. Teach postgrads+ECRs. Keynote speaker. For hire worldwide. "Whirlwind of awesome" (@tseenster). She/her. #ActuallyAutistic 🌈
tweet: @B_Blastitude Depends on your career plans. Books are much more useful for independent researchers. Journal articles are often more useful for academics. For practice-based researchers, it doesn't much matter #VirtualNotViral

name: Helen Kara 🇺🇦 #FreeUkraine
description: Indie researcher+author. Teach postgrads+ECRs. Keynote speaker. For hire worldwide. "Whirlwind of awesome" (@tseenster). She/her. #ActuallyAutistic 🌈
tweet: @ThomsonPat Yes; this. The book proposal is an advertisement for your writing, in a sense. If you know an experienced writer who can give you feedback before you submit your proposal, that would be useful. And proof-read carefully, don't rely on the automatic spell checker #VirtualNotViral

name: Helen Kara 🇺🇦 #FreeUkraine
description: Indie researcher+author. Teach postgrads+ECRs. Keynote speaker. For hire worldwide. "Whirlwind of awesome" (@tseenster). She/her. #ActuallyAutistic 🌈
tweet: @writeleighso Wow! Did you walk to the seaside?

name: Helen Kara 🇺🇦 #FreeUkraine
description: Indie researcher+author. Teach postgrads+ECRs. Keynote speaker. For hire worldwide. "Whirlwind of awesome" (@tseenster). She/her. #ActuallyAutistic 🌈
tweet: @virtualnotviral Also, don't big yourself up; there is no need. Information about writing achievements is relevant, and a doctoral thesis or dissertation definitely counts. Otherwise, the publisher most wants to know whether you can write, so let your writing speak for itself #VirtualNotViral

name: Helen Kara 🇺🇦 #FreeUkraine
description: Indie researcher+author. Teach postgrads+ECRs. Keynote speaker. For hire worldwide. "Whirlwind of awesome" (@tseenster). She/her. #ActuallyAutistic 🌈
tweet: @virtualnotviral Claims you can't back up. As with any academic writing, demonstration is far more powerful than assertion. Also anything more than the publisher asks for in their guidelines, unless it is truly relevant (and concise). #VirtualNotViral

name: Helen Kara 🇺🇦 #FreeUkraine
description: Indie researcher+author. Teach postgrads+ECRs. Keynote speaker. For hire worldwide. "Whirlwind of awesome" (@tseenster). She/her. #ActuallyAutistic 🌈
tweet: @virtualnotviral Yes, you absolutely can email series editors. @ThomsonPat and I are always happy to answer emails about book ideas for the series we edit (this one https://t.co/SvsjMx1dIY) #VirtualNotViral

name: Helen Kara 🇺🇦 #FreeUkraine
description: Indie researcher+author. Teach postgrads+ECRs. Keynote speaker. For hire worldwide. "Whirlwind of awesome" (@tseenster). She/her. #ActuallyAutistic 🌈
tweet: @DrMeghaTyagi @virtualnotviral So for your book proposal: think first about who your readers will be. What is the audience you want to reach? Then, which kind of publishing will be best for that? (Hint: may not be academic.) Then, how can you best tell them your story? #VirtualNotViral

name: Helen Kara 🇺🇦 #FreeUkraine
description: Indie researcher+author. Teach postgrads+ECRs. Keynote speaker. For hire worldwide. "Whirlwind of awesome" (@tseenster). She/her. #ActuallyAutistic 🌈
tweet: @DrMeghaTyagi @virtualnotviral In brief: a book has a different purpose from a thesis. Your thesis is designed to help convince your examiners that you have reached a certain academic standard. This is why PhD theses are very rarely publishable as books without a lot of restructuring+rewriting #VirtualNotViral

name: Helen Kara 🇺🇦 #FreeUkraine
description: Indie researcher+author. Teach postgrads+ECRs. Keynote speaker. For hire worldwide. "Whirlwind of awesome" (@tseenster). She/her. #ActuallyAutistic 🌈
tweet: @DrMeghaTyagi @virtualnotviral I cannot resist a shameless plug here for my book with @einterview in the series @ThomsonPat and I edit https://t.co/EVDWsfMRJf

name: Helen Kara 🇺🇦 #FreeUkraine
description: Indie researcher+author. Teach postgrads+ECRs. Keynote speaker. For hire worldwide. "Whirlwind of awesome" (@tseenster). She/her. #ActuallyAutistic 🌈
tweet: @Anntics I think a lot of people have that impression. It may seem counter-intuitive, but publishers need writers more than writers need publishers, and even more so these days as self-publishing is always an option #VirtualNotViral

name: Helen Kara 🇺🇦 #FreeUkraine
description: Indie researcher+author. Teach postgrads+ECRs. Keynote speaker. For hire worldwide. "Whirlwind of awesome" (@tseenster). She/her. #ActuallyAutistic 🌈
tweet: @virtualnotviral In fact the whole proposal needs to be thorough. It will be reviewed by experts - and the commissioning editor will send it back to you first, for more work, if it is not thorough enough #VirtualNotViral

name: Helen Kara 🇺🇦 #FreeUkraine
description: Indie researcher+author. Teach postgrads+ECRs. Keynote speaker. For hire worldwide. "Whirlwind of awesome" (@tseenster). She/her. #ActuallyAutistic 🌈
tweet: @virtualnotviral The competitor analysis needs to be thorough: to prove the book you propose (a) doesn't already exist and (b) is truly needed #VirtualNotViral

name: Helen Kara 🇺🇦 #FreeUkraine
description: Indie researcher+author. Teach postgrads+ECRs. Keynote speaker. For hire worldwide. "Whirlwind of awesome" (@tseenster). She/her. #ActuallyAutistic 🌈
tweet: @virtualnotviral Publishers' guidelines vary a bit, but you will always need to include a synopsis and chapter-by-chapter outline of the proposed book, an argument for why it should be written, and a competitor analysis #VirtualNotViral

name: Helen Kara 🇺🇦 #FreeUkraine
description: Indie researcher+author. Teach postgrads+ECRs. Keynote speaker. For hire worldwide. "Whirlwind of awesome" (@tseenster). She/her. #ActuallyAutistic 🌈
tweet: @virtualnotviral A book proposal is a document a would-be writer writes for a publisher to propose a specific book which the writer has thought of and wants the publisher to publish. You start by choosing a publisher and finding their book proposal guidelines on their website #VirtualNotViral

name: Helen Kara 🇺🇦 #FreeUkraine

tweet: Some #CRMethods people may be interested in this https://t.co/dxFl9n9O84

name: Helen Kara 🇺🇦 #FreeUkraine
description: Indie researcher+author. Teach postgrads+ECRs. Keynote speaker. For hire worldwide. "Whirlwind of awesome" (@tseenster). She/her. #ActuallyAutistic 🌈
tweet: @ThomsonPat Agree. Commissioning editors are very approachable and like talking about books! (These are the editors you need to talk to at this stage; the others are copy-editors who check your manuscript for errors. Can be confusing but they are two very different jobs.) #VirtualNotViral

name: Helen Kara 🇺🇦 #FreeUkraine
description: Indie researcher+author. Teach postgrads+ECRs. Keynote speaker. For hire worldwide. "Whirlwind of awesome" (@tseenster). She/her. #ActuallyAutistic 🌈
tweet: @virtualnotviral Hi Idris, they are different because a book is different from a research project. A book proposal should explain why the book is needed and who will read it. The research proposal should explain why the research is needed and how it will be done #VirtualNotViral

tweet: @HelmeRachel @virtualnotviral Look at the books you read and enjoy and/or admire, and see who publishes them. Then ask other people who write for them about their experience - Twitter DMs are a great way to do this #VirtualNotViral

name: Helen Kara 🇺🇦 #FreeUkraine

tweet: @bianca_oli_per With self-publishing everything is under your control, but on the other hand you have to do everything yourself, or pay others to do it: editing, formatting, cover design, publishing, marketing etc #VirtualNotViral

name: Helen Kara 🇺🇦 #FreeUkraine
description: Indie researcher+author. Teach postgrads+ECRs. Keynote speaker. For hire worldwide. "Whirlwind of awesome" (@tseenster). She/her. #ActuallyAutistic 🌈
tweet: @bianca_oli_per With an academic publisher you get peer review which can be very helpful, though that is not guaranteed. With non-academic you may get wider circulation and more sales, though again not guaranteed. #VirtualNotViral

tweet: @_LisaCherry @delythsedwards I found out from reading @rdunbaro excellent book https://t.co/3GIbpZGyZ3 really useful for my research ethics teaching - no it is not just Tuskegee/Milgram etc and all in the past, it is this and ethics dumping and fraud and it all goes on today.

name: Helen Kara 🇺🇦 #FreeUkraine
description: Indie researcher+author. Teach postgrads+ECRs. Keynote speaker. For hire worldwide. "Whirlwind of awesome" (@tseenster). She/her. #ActuallyAutistic 🌈
tweet: @_LisaCherry @delythsedwards I think we need a replacement for 'data' though because categorising things as data allows researchers to deny others their rights. name: Helen Kara 🇺🇦 #FreeUkraine

tweet: @_LisaCherry @delythsedwards I do. The terminology around research can be quite slippery and doesn't always fit. I have been using 'data gathering' since 2015 to encompass both collection and construction. I like 'wisdom gathering' though I'm not sure all research actually does that... 1/2

tweet: @NomadicMScott @SuzanneCulshaw @JFletcherSaxon Good idea to use your most productive time. All progress is good progress. tweet: @SuzanneCulshaw @MobileMScott I agree. Part of the point being that 'researchers' and 'participants' are actually people, who are all multi-skilled and expert in some areas. Bringing all of that to our research makes data richer, findings more robust - and research more fun! #CRMethodsChat

tweet: @SuzanneCulshaw @Christina_QDAS Also offering people the option to contribute verbally or in writing in the chat. I think a lot of making participants comfortable is about offering them choices of how they participate #CRMethodsChat

name: Helen Kara 🇺🇦 #FreeUkraine
description: Indie researcher+author. Teach postgrads+ECRs. Keynote speaker. For hire worldwide. "Whirlwind of awesome" (@tseenster). She/her. #ActuallyAutistic 🌈
tweet: Q4: How would you deal with participants’ scepticism towards/resistance to creative research methods? Answer with A4 and don’t forget the hashtag #CRMethodsChat

name: Helen Kara 🇺🇦 #FreeUkraine
description: Indie researcher+author. Teach postgrads+ECRs. Keynote speaker. For hire worldwide. "Whirlwind of awesome" (@tseenster). She/her. #ActuallyAutistic 🌈
tweet: @_balyasnikova @SuzanneCulshaw When you think about it, that is not ethical at all. Indigenous researchers take the opposite approach: for them, research serves and strengthens existing relationships, or it is unethical #CRMethodsChat 2/2

name: Helen Kara 🇺🇦 #FreeUkraine
description: Indie researcher+author. Teach postgrads+ECRs. Keynote speaker. For hire worldwide. "Whirlwind of awesome" (@tseenster). She/her. #ActuallyAutistic 🌈
tweet: @_balyasnikova @SuzanneCulshaw This is so interesting and I think so important. Euro-Western researchers are taught to 'create rapport' i.e. to be instrumental about relationships, to use our friendship skills to obtain data and then disappear again #CRMethodsChat 1/2

name: Helen Kara 🇺🇦 #FreeUkraine
description: Indie researcher+author. Teach postgrads+ECRs. Keynote speaker. For hire worldwide. "Whirlwind of awesome" (@tseenster). She/her. #ActuallyAutistic 🌈
tweet: @SuzanneCulshaw I am hearing more and more from researchers about working to build relationships with participants before they actually participate - and maintaining those relationships afterwards... #CRMethodsChat

name: Helen Kara 🇺🇦 #FreeUkraine
description: Indie researcher+author. Teach postgrads+ECRs. Keynote speaker. For hire worldwide. "Whirlwind of awesome" (@tseenster). She/her. #ActuallyAutistic 🌈
tweet: @_balyasnikova @SuzanneCulshaw Very important point Natalia that researchers too can find ourselves uncomfortable in the face of some research methods. It is worth taking a step outside of our comfort zones, but not pushing ourselves too far IMO #CRMethodsChat

name: Helen Kara 🇺🇦 #FreeUkraine

tweet: Q3: What do you do to establish a safe, creative atmosphere, referred to in the literature as an ‘aesthetic environment’? Answer with A3 and don’t forget to use the hashtag #CRMethodsChat

tweet: @SuzanneCulshaw Yes I think collage is one of the more accessible arts-based methods. It is easier to get across the message that 'you can't do it wrong' (as I frequently tell participants, and students too!) #CRMethodsChat

Instead, our system considers things like how recent a review is and if the reviewer bought the item on Amazon. It also analyses reviews to verify trustworthiness."1/2

tweet: @angelagregory28 Absolutely agree some #CRMethods can be daunting for some people - which brings us to Q4 - my top pro tip is: offer a range of options/activities so participants can choose how they want to engage #CRMethodsChat

tweet: @angelagregory28 @AnujaCabraal So do I. And we are not alone; I have found quant researchers arguing this from various fields including behavioural science, evidence-based social work, midwifery, and sociology/Native studies. Refs available on request! #CRMethodsChat

tweet: @AnujaCabraal Absolutely Anuja, I think reflexivity is essential throughout research work. And there is a lovely synergy between reflexivity and creativity in research #CRMethodsChat
